alert.note: Alert for Dade (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 7:13PM EST until February 24 at 1:51PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Tennessee... Lookout Creek near New England affecting Dade and Hamilton Counties. For the Lookout Creek...including New England...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Lookout Creek near New England. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...Between 13 and 15 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand along Sells Lane in Trenton...Mason Road near Rising Fawn... and Creek Road near New England. These roads and other roads with creeks flowing into Lookout Creek will flood causing the roads to be closed. The water will be a few feet deep on portions of these roads. Also minor flooding will continue to expand downstream as the creek crosses the Tennessee border into the Tiftonia area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Wednesday was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It is forecasted to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.8 feet on 02/28/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
